Selecting Source and Target Objects

Before using View Manager on the Cross-Platform client, you must choose the source and target objects that will appear in the upper panes of the window. You can do this  by selecting objects directly in the View Manager window or by opening a Properties file.

Selecting Objects Directly

To select a source object from the View Manager window:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • Select Server > Select from the menu bar.

    • Click the Select Source Server button on the toolbar.

      • The Select a Server dialog appears.

  2. Select a server from the Available servers list box.

  3. Click OK. The server appears in both upper panes of the View Manager window.

  4. Use the tree in the left pane to select an object.

    5. If you want to configure the source view to a particular view label or promotion state:

    1. Select View > Configure Source View. The Select a View Configuration dialog appears.

    2. Select the Labeled configuration or promotion state configuration option.

    3. Select a view label or a promotion state from the drop-down list box below the selected option button.

    4. Click OK.

To select a target object from the View Manager window:

From the tree in the right pane, select an object.

Opening a Properties File

Opening a properties file selects both a source and target object for a View Manager merge. The properties file contains information about the source and target objects and all the options used for the run. It specifies everything but the run type. A properties file has the extension .srm.

To open an existing properties file:

Do one of the following:

  • Select File > Open from the menu bar.

  • Click the Open Properties File button on the toolbar.

For more information, see Creating and Using Properties Files.
